gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: JPSS VIIRS Active Fires (AF) EDR from IDPS

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NCEI > National Centers for Environmental Information, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce
DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/STAR/SMCD > Satellite Meteorology and Climatology Division, Center for Satellite Applications and Research, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce
UMD/GEOG/LCRS > Land Cover and Remote Sensing, Geography Department, University of Maryland,
NOAA JPSS Program Office

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: UMD project website

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: NESDIS STAR JPSS Active Fires Team

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA project website

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This dataset contains an operational environmental data record (EDR) that contains pinpoint locations of active fires (AF) as identified by an algorithm based on the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) Fires and Thermal Anomalies Collection 4 product, but improved upon and adapted for use by the Visible Infrared Imaging Radiometer (VIIRS) instrument onboard the Suomi-NPP satellite. The algorithm utilizes sensor data from the 4 micron and 11 micron spectral bands (M13 and M15), at a spatial resolution of 750 meters at nadir to deliver a list of fire pixels at a given location on Earth approximately every 12 hours. By default, AF data obtained from the Comprehensive Large Array-Data Stewardship System (CLASS) are distributed as aggregated files of four 86-second granules in HDF5 file format with metadata attributes.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This dataset provides a high quality environmental data record (EDR) of active thermal anomalies on the Earth's surface. These data could be used to plot areas of active fires for use in fire monitoring, management, and planning.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: DOC/NOAA/NESDIS/NCEI > National Centers for Environmental Information, NESDIS, NOAA, U.S. Department of Commerce

gmd:fileDescription.gco:CharacterString: Active Fire locations overlayed with true color RGB imagery over the Northern California bay area. Image courtesy of University of Maryland Active Fires Team.

gmd:keyword.gco:CharacterString: EARTH SCIENCE > BIOSPHERE > ECOLOGICAL DYNAMICS > FIRE ECOLOGY > FIRE OCCURRENCE
EARTH SCIENCE > HUMAN DIMENSIONS > NATURAL HAZARDS > WILDFIRES

gmd:other.gco:CharacterString: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA created the National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) by merging NOAA's National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), and National Oceanographic Data Center (NODC), including the National Coastal Data Development Center (NCDDC), per the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015, Public Law 113-235. NCEI launched publicly on April 22, 2015.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: The Data Stewardship Maturity Matrix (DSMM) is a unified framework that defines criteria for each of nine components based on measurable practices, which can be used to apply a progressive, 6-level rating to an individual dataset, representing stewardship maturity stages rated as Not Assessed or Not Available (Level 0), adHoc (Level 1), minimum (Level 2), intermediate (Level 3), advanced (Level 4), and optimal (Level 5).

gmd:evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: Data Stewardship Maturity Assessment was evaluated by the metadata content editor for the NOAA OneStop project using the Scientific Data Stewardship Maturity Assessment Model Template v4.0.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: The Scientific Data Stewardship Maturity Assessment Model Template

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: CICS-NC/NCEI

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: The Scientific Data Stewardship Maturity Assessment Model Template
